Text.Value: We have faith here, Bill. Faith in people - no matter where they're from.
Is there any victim more fitting, than one who would forgive his own murderer?
Bill, I beg you, be quiet.

EditorData.NodeContext: whispered to bill in hushed tones

Text.Value: Who had more faith than Father Lorgan? How did that work out?

EditorData.NodeContext: getting more upset and loud, emphasis on 'that'

Text.Value: I heard your priest died. My condolences.
Leave.
I'll leave you to it.
'Passing'? He was murdered. By one of the fugitives he was harbouring.
Sounds like it didn't work out great.
You seem a kind soul. Our temple is open to you - walk well.
Father Lorgan instructed us to welcome everyone. That was his edict - that is Ilmater's edict.

EditorData.NodeContext: getting angry now, pissed at player for being cheeky after the high priest died

Text.Value: I'm sorry you had to witness our squabbling. Our temple is open to you - walk well.
Does Ilmater's service involve protecting heretic Absolutists? Perhaps I missed that sermon -
Even sinners receive Ilmater's grace, and Father Lorgan knew that. We don't pick and choose who we aid.
He was murdered. Or so I've heard.
Enough, Bill.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Priest 02 turrns to address the player at the end here
EditorData.NodeContext: losing his patience with Bill here

Text.Value: All I'm saying is we'd be a lot better off without murderous refugees roaming -
Thank you, stranger. I take some solace knowing that he died in Ilmater's service.
Imagine fleeing to the city, only to be met with suspicion. The refugees face hardship at every turn.
To offer alms to all who need it - that is the sign of a noble soul.
Sounds like your god would be proud of Father Lorgan.
We let more outsiders in, and more Baldurians die. Duke Stelmane, Father Lorgan; it's no coincidence!

EditorData.NodeContext: almost like a muttered whisper - this is minorly blasphemous so he doesn't want everyone hearing. (Stelmane = STEL-mane.)

Text.Value: Our high priest was harbouring fugitives, and one of them murdered him.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: He begins addressing the other priest during this

Text.Value: What are you two talking about?
Exactly. Lorgan let a killer into our temple due to his misguided compassion - his faith got him murdered.
Thank you, stranger. Father Lorgan's passing has saddened us all.
If Father Lorgan had been pickier, he might still been alive.

Synopsis:
You see priests who are arguing.
The head priest was killed recently. One of the priests thinks that he was too welcoming to refugees, the other one disagrees.
